definition: nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Chronic conditions are managed equally well with chiropractic or yoga.

sentences.english: Those college girls went slumming and came home with sex diseases.

sentences.english: A facultative pathogen of some insect species commonly used as a biopesticide.
sentences.chinese: 一些昆虫的兼性病原物，常用作生物杀虫剂。

sentences.english: I could no longer work because I caught so many STDs and infections.

sentences.english: Which Jilin family hospital cures andropathy comparatively well?

sentences.english: There is a posterior midline fatty lesion consistent with lipoma.

sentences.english: It is said that hard chancres are a kind of syphilis that is hard to cure.
sentences.chinese: 听说下疳是一种特别难以治愈的性病。

sentences.english: SenileThe person grows cancer easily to give birth to tumour, also be proliferous sex pathological change.

sentences.english: All Libras die of venereal disease.
This makes it easier to get viral and bacterial infections.

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the value of CT diagnosing intraluminal masses of small intestine.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨小肠腔内肿块性病变的CT诊断价值。

sentences.english: Social Hygiene Service is a specialist clinical service for sexually transmitted infection in Hong Kong.

sentences.english: Bronchoscope has higher value to the diagnosis of pulmonary cavity.

sentences.english: Conclusion MR is bettler than CT in the lesion of cerebellum infarction.
sentences.chinese: 结论小脑梗塞性病变MR检查优于CT检查。
